Ok,

I do :

- Right-click;
- "add expression"
- OK

Exactly like CDT 1.2.1, but nothing is done, no message, ... nothing !

Doesn't it appear in the Expressions view? Unlike, 1.2.1 the Expressions view 
doesn't become active (maybe, it should). The platform implementation of the 
Expressions view support has been changed in Eclipse 3.0.
BTW, you can use the "Add Globals" option of the Variables view to watch global 
variables.

Hum, ok, after a big fight, I found the "Expressions view" and it appears it works.
But why this "important" view is hidden ??

>But why this "important" view is hidden ??
Well, that's a question to the platform people... But as soon as you open it it 
will stay in your perspective.
Anyway, I've submitted an enhancement request for this: 
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=69184.
